title: Architects Against Themselves
sub_head: Why I quit the American Institute of Architects.
body:
Like Holman Jenkins, Jr.’s correspondent referenced in “Climate Sanity Lost and Found” (Business World, June 11), I am a 60-something architect. Accustomed to being the conductor of a design and building process, we architects think we are authorities on everything. Just ask my wife.
I have watched younger indoctrinates of the left take over the American Institute of Architects, our professional organization. My peers, such as “Alvin Muffley,” participate in the debacle, partly out of baby-boomer guilt. The prior generation has retired and no longer tempers the well-meaning but misguided youth.
